thread.title: HAPPENING TODAY: Gubernatorial campaign reports due; cooler temp
thread.title_full: HAPPENING TODAY: Gubernatorial campaign reports due; cooler temp - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: HAPPENING TODAY: Gubernatorial campaign reports due; cooler temp
text:
Campaign fundraising reports due today
We're anticipating details into how much money people running for Louisiana governor have made. The latest fundraising reports are due today. They will show just how much money the candidates and PAC's supporting them have. It's could be the last campaign filing day before the election. The election is on this Saturday.
Cold front bring comfortable temperatures; feel-good air
After a cold front passed through the area Tuesday, drier air has begun filtering in. Dry air allows overnight and morning temps to drop into the low 50s...even some 40s!...and low 60s. But with ample sunshine, afternoon temperatures will rise above the normal and reach the mid and upper 80s. This will be the case as we wrap up the week. But a stronger cold front will move through early Saturday with cooler air. Afternoons this weekend will remain in the 70s. Winds will also increase behind the weekend front.
Orleans Parish School System Town Hall
This evening, school administrators, teachers, and parents can learn more about the future of the Orleans Parish school system. It's all part of a series of town hall meetings hosted by the school board. Tonight's meeting is for people in District 2. It begins at 6 p.m. at Landry-Walker High School. Superintendent Henderson Lewis will talk about the new administration and his vision for the future.
